definition: reign title/era name (name for either the entire reign of an emperor or one part of it)/year number (such as 2016 or 甲子)
grain/harvest (old)/variant of 年[nian2]
surname Nian
year/CL:個|个[ge4]
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: There are various ideological connotations in the reign-titles of Chinese feudal emperors in different periods.
sentences.chinese: 不同时期封建帝王的年号，均包含着丰富的思想内涵。

sentences.english: The following year the first month to establish Dashun regime era name Yongchang.
sentences.chinese: 次年正月，建立大顺政权，年号永昌。

sentences.english: Why do some porcelain wares hare reign-Marks, while others don't?
sentences.chinese: 为什么有的瓷器上面有年号款，有的没有呢？

definition: to change an emperor's or ruler's reign title (old)
official name of a nation (includes dynastic names of China: 漢|汉[Han4], 唐[Tang2] etc)
temple name of a deceased Chinese emperor
to number the years/calendar era/annals/chronicle
the Xin dynasty (8-23 AD) of Wang Mang 王莽, forming the interregnum between the former and later Han
to succeed to a title/to inherit
emperor/CL:個|个[ge4]
to succeed to the throne/accession
Xuande Emperor, reign name of fifth Ming emperor Zhu Zhanji 朱瞻基[Zhu1 Zhan1 ji1] (1398-1435), reigned 1426-1436, Temple name 明宣宗[Ming2 Xuan1 zong1]
reign name (1909-1911) of the last Qing emperor Pu Yi 溥儀|溥仪
CE (Common Era)/Christian Era/AD (Anno Domini)
coin/to mint (coins)
on the throne/reigning (monarch)
first day of the first lunar month/(old) calendar promulgated by the first emperor of a dynasty
posthumous name and title
Hongwu Emperor, also written Hung-wu Ti, reign name of first Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋[Zhu1 Yuan2 zhang1] (1328-1398), reigned 1386-1398, Temple name 明太祖[Ming2 Tai4 zu3]
